xxl.core.pipes.operators.mappers
Class Aggregator<I,O>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.operators.AbstractPipe<I,O>
          xxl.core.pipes.operators.mappers.Aggregator<I,O>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pipe<I,O>, Node, Sink<I>, Source<O>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ReservoirSampler
public class Aggregator<I,O>
extends AbstractPipe<I,O>

Operator component in a query graph that performs an incremental aggregation. User-defined binary aggregation functions are applied to an incoming element as follows: 

        aggregate = function.invoke(aggregate, o)
So the next aggregation value is computed by applying the binary aggregation function to the last aggreation value and the incoming element o. After that the new computed aggregation value is transferred to all subscribed sinks.
Futhermore the OnlineAggregator offers the possibility to define more than one aggregation function, e.g., the user is able to compute a sum and an average of the same input stream simultaneously in only one operator.
Note: The aggregation function has to handle the situation that the parameter aggregate may be null. In that case the aggregate has to be initialized correctly.

Example usage (1): 

        new Printer(
                new OnlineAggregator(
                        new RandomNumber(new JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper(), 100, 10, false),
                        new Average()
                )
        );

Since:
1.1
See Also:
Function

Constructor Detail

Aggregator

public Aggregator(AggregationFunction<? super I,O> function)

Aggregator

public Aggregator(Source<? extends I> source,
                  int sourceID,
                  AggregationFunction<? super I,O> function)
Creates a new OnlineAggregator as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
sourceID - This pipe uses the given ID for subscription.
function - Binary aggregation function, that is applied to the last aggregation value and the next incoming element. It returns the next aggregation value.

Aggregator

public Aggregator(Source<? extends I> source,
                  AggregationFunction<? super I,O> function)
Creates a new OnlineAggregator as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately. The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
function - Binary aggregation function, that is applied to the last aggregation value and the next incoming element. It returns the next aggregation value.
Method Detail

processObject

public void processObject(I o,
                          int sourceID)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
The binary aggregation function is applied to the last aggregation value and the given element. The resulting new aggregation value is transferred to all of this pipe's subscribed sinks by calling super.transfer(aggregate).
The implementation looks as follows: 

        super.transfer(aggregate = function.invoke(aggregate, o));

Specified by:
processObject in class AbstractPipe<I,O>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
ID - The ID this pipe specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.
